intro: Varronia andreana, commonly known as the Brazilian star apple, is a tropical evergreen tree native to South America. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its smooth, grayish bark and broad, lobed leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers followed by edible, star-shaped fruits that are rich in nutrients. Its botanical features make it a valuable species for both ornamental and agricultural purposes. Varronia andreana is also noted for its ability to thrive in humid, tropical climates with well-drained soil.
